poem:
**Gulf Divide**

Ink and ocean mix where words clash,  
names altered on a whimsy's wave.  
In rooms where voices echo, shut—  
the tide of truth finds doors unlatched.  
Banners wrap the journal's page,  
but seas resist such border's cage.  
Let lines on maps be drawn on air,  
news unbound by lines unfair.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "AP excoriates White House barring of reporters as ‘alarming precedent’ The executive editor of the Associated Press sent a letter to the White House on Wednesday criticizing its decision to block two of its journalists from attending press events on Tuesday after the outlet refused to refer to the Gulf of Mexico as “the Gulf of America”. “I write on behalf of The Associated Press, an independent global news organization that reaches billions of people". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
